Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Clavicle \Clav"i*cle\, n. [F. clavicule, fr. L. clavicula a little key, tendril, dim. of clavis key, akin to claudere to shut. See {Close}, and cf. {Clef}.] (Anat.) The collar bone, which is joined at one end to the scapula, or shoulder blade, and at the other to the sternum, or breastbone. In man each clavicle is shaped like the letter ?, and is situated just above the first rib on either side of the neck. In birds the two clavicles are united ventrally, forming the merrythought, or wishbone. [1913 Webster]
clavicle n : bone linking the scapula and sternum [syn: {collarbone}]
